newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares seen slipping on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares seen slipping on profit-taking.

text.p: Singapore shares could slip further on Friday after the key index fell 20 points on Thursday, dealers said.
The Straits Times Industrials Index dropped 20 points to 2,199.67 at Thursday's close.
With a lack of real themes to drive Singapore share prices on, dealers expected profit-taking to dominate activity.
"I think people are getting a little concerned about being caught at the top, even if this is only a short term top," said one dealer.
Brighter news is seen next week when share trading begin in infrastructure company, Wee Poh Holdings, the latest initial public offering (IPO) to come into the Singapore market.
Its offer was 101 times subscribed and trading on a "when issued" basis starts on Monday.
Dealers see IPOs and small shares as the keenest area of interest in the current cycle of the Singapore market.
